Articles.Content:
This is my MiG-29 replica, which also happens to be very similar in size to the real thing (1.5m shorter). It is capable of doing "Pugachev's Cobra," but it requires you to be at ~300m/s and above. The craft tops out at around 380m/s at sea level, and is highly maneuverable

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/yHxNz)

[Download](https://www.dropbox.com/s/j5nsg9z9sxwxbsf/MiG-29%20Fulcrum.craft?dl=0)

**Modded versions (uses** [**BDArmory**](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/90/BahamutoDs%20Armory) **and** [**BD Dynamics**](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/101/Bahamuto_Dynamics_Parts_pack_v1.1)**)**

MiG-29SM "Fulcrum-C" (Air-to-Ground)

[Download](https://www.dropbox.com/s/ukwi6j4ng81g5ew/MiG-29%20Fulcrum%28A-G%29.craft?dl=0)

Mig-29M "Fulcrum-E" (Air-to-air)

[Download](https://www.dropbox.com/s/eew65x4lvcfkku7/MiG-29%20Fulcrum%28A-A%29.craft?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-28T06:12:09Z" title="08/28/2015 06:12  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 28, 2015</time> by Yaeah**
This might be your best one yet. Nice work dude. What controls the wings?

> 
> This might be your best one yet. Nice work dude. What controls the wings?

Thanks! For the tailplanes? I used 3 standard canards packed near each other on each side to match the shape of the 29's

> 
> Thanks! For the tailplanes? I used 3 standard canards packed near each other on each side to match the shape of the 29's

Oh sorry I thought pic 3 had two of the same craft. And that the wings could rotate. Nice synchronized flying by the way.

> 
> Oh sorry I thought pic 3 had two of the same craft. And that the wings could rotate. Nice synchronized flying by the way.

It was done with a friend in DMP ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> It was done with a friend in DMP ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

So DMP works better these days? Last time I played you couldn't see other craft in the atmosphere.

> 
> So DMP works better these days? Last time I played you couldn't see other craft in the atmosphere.

It definitely can if both parties have good internet.

I'm usually on the NoName server fyi
